text:
THE PRINCE ALBERT TIMES

AND BASKETCHEWAN REVIEW

SPINK & MAVEETY

PRINCE ALBERT, N.W.T.

BRITISH POLITICAL OUTLOOK

It is reported that the question is shortly to be placed and that Gladstone expects to be out of office in a day or two. It seems certain that the Government will be detached on the Egyptian Policy, and active preparations are being made throughout the country against the policy. Mr. Waddington, French Statesman, has assured that the change will be made without delay.

EDITORIAL NOTES

The American papers are not in favour of the remodelling of the Egyptian government, but the English press is divided. The Times, for instance, is favourable to the change, while the Daily Telegraph is opposed to it.

R. H. BRATNOBER

Harness, Saddles, Bridles, Collars, Curry Combs, Brushes, Whips, Etc.

Repairing and Job Work promptly and neatly executed.

THE WEEK

The advantages of being the President in the White House will certainly be felt by Mr. Gladstone. He will have the opportunity of making a speech to the nation, and will be able to address the people of England in person.

East End Bakery.

PUBLIC NOTICE

All persons are hereby required to take notice that the land in the public hands without authority from the Minister of Agriculture is liable to be disposed of under the provisions of the Dominion Lands Act, and that any person who may be found to have committed an offence in connection therewith shall be liable to prosecution.

FURNITURE

Just arrived. In addition to our large stock we have received some Fancy Parlor Bedroom Sets, Sideboards, Bureaus, Bedsteads, Couches, Sofas, Chairs of nearly all descriptions, Cradles, Cribs for the Babies, Rocking Chairs for the Ladies, Mattresses Single & Double to suit Customers.

C. & G. E. CARTER, KNOX BARKER, CARPENTERS, ETC.

OFFICE AND WORKSHOP.

Near Presbyterian Church.

FIRE! FIRE! FIRE!

PUMP ON WATER

Wells Sunk and Pumps Made and Repaired.

Orders left at J. L. Johnson & Co.'s will be promptly attended to.

NATHANIEL ACORN

Prince Albert.
ITEMS OF INTEREST

THE VERY LATEST NEWS.

CANADIAN.

FRIDAY, JUNE 27, 1884.

NEW YORK, June 15.—Wm. Sexton, the billiard player, met with a serious accident today, being pulled out of his chair by a sudden shock, and has been taken to hospital in two places.

PRINCE EDWARD ISLAND.

The Lieutenant-Governor's term of office will expire nearly at the end of next month, and the question of electing a successor is now being discussed in various parts of the island. The opinions of the people are divided, and there is no clear indication as to who will be elected.

NOTICE!

J. L. JOHNSON & CO.

Beg to announce to their customers that after June 30th their terms will be net cash to all who do not make satisfactory settlement of their accounts to that date.

N.B. -- A good supply of American Coal Oil now on hand.

J. L. JOHNSON & CO.

Buffalo Hall!

Parties concerned will please take notice that overdue accounts on our books have been closed, and will now be placed in the hands of our solicitors for collection.

From this date we propose devoting our attention to prompt paying and cash customers, and will be prepared to offer them reliable goods at prices in keeping with the times.
